column5: got out to  one of my favorite little lakes for a few hours last night hoping to get a couple walleyes missed a really good bite right at dark and that was it but after it got dark i started to mark these fish coming half way up off bottom and give my minnow a bump then go back down. i figured it could only be one thing so put on a smaller jig and some maggots and BINGO got onto some nice slabs kept half a dozen of the big ones for a snack threw the rest back, no walleyes but i guess these will have to do   oh by the way all these pics were taken with the iphone   does a better job than my digital      this was the size of the throwbacks     last weekend got onto a few pike there small but fun to catch on the spoon in 30 fow went 3 for 3
Nice lookin catch man !!!!!!!!! Those Crappie look like real slabs !!Thanks for showin
Wow, those are some nice slabs!! That's one fish I wanna put a beating on through the ice this year.

Hey theres nothing wrong with a pan full of crappie even the snot rocket is good for an interesting fight!  now im drewlling. but my hut is out on simcoe as of yesterday and tomorrow my son and I are gone for the weekend!!!!
Nice job. Planning on trying to get some crappie this year though the ice too.
Nice crappies... I wonder if you would have noticed them without the fish finder.
Yeah...I think I'd trade those slabs for walleye....nicely done!
I will take a crappie any day over a walleye for eating. Nice lot of fish.  Art

thanks for the comments guys and trust me im not complaining crappies are my favorite.rodcaster this is my 3rd year with a flasher and the more i use it the more i love it. these fish would only eat if your bait was half way off bottom. definitelly helped me ice those slabs

I have spent countless hours watching my electronics and from my earliest days of using a black and white flasher to my lss-1 unit of today I still flip the switch to the flasher mode to help me understand what I am looking at.   Art
